definition: to set one's heart on sth (idiom)
to dig for thoughts (idiom); to search everything for an answer/to rack one's brains
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through

sentences.english: She was embarrassed when they kept telling her she had a genius for mathematics.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是對她說她有數學蠢才，她覺得很不好心思。

sentences.english: It will not mean things like levitating objects and reading others minds.
sentences.chinese: 它不會是把物體升空和看穿別人的心思之類的事。

sentences.english: I want to go there, can you take with me?
sentences.chinese: 僅這個夢想，我花盡了心思。

sentences.english: You become a mind reader and a fortune teller.
sentences.chinese: 你變成了一個揣摩別人心思的人，一個算命先生。

sentences.english: It is a funky restaurant with very interesting art on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 那是一家牆上掛着很成心思的繪畫的新潮餐館。

sentences.english: Listen to your thoughts. See the details of your surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 傾聽自己的心思，觀察身邊的每一個小細節。

sentences.english: The mind should be directed in the right channel, according to well-formed plans.
sentences.chinese: 要依照周全的計劃，指導心思順着正當的方向。

sentences.english: All he ever thinks about is to get a good job.
sentences.chinese: 他現在一門心思想找一份好工作。

sentences.english: If you don't concentrate on your work, you can accomplish nothing.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不把心思放在工作上，你終將一事無成。

sentences.english: Moments later, Bo Ya's mind turned to a torrent of water.
sentences.chinese: 過了一會兒，伯牙的心思轉到流水那兒去了。

sentences.english: Lead the relationship between back and double grace, specially effort to coax back double grace.
sentences.chinese: 辛勇爲了挽回與雙怡的關係，特地花心思哄回雙怡。

sentences.english: Put your thoughts into some trendy new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 可把心思放在現今流行的新思潮上。

sentences.english: They now walked on in silence; each of them deep in thought.
sentences.chinese: 他們倆默不作聲地往前走，各人在想各人的心思。

sentences.english: Can you sum up the central idea of this ancient poem in plain terms?
sentences.chinese: 你能用簡明的語言概括這首古詩的中心思想嗎？

sentences.english: You can buy your kids things they need, but with a twist.
sentences.chinese: 你可以給孩子買一些他們需要的，但也得發一些心思。

sentences.english: I busied myself with shopping, then turned my attention to our Thanksgiving table.
sentences.chinese: 我忙着購物，然後一門心思都撲到感恩節大餐上。
